intro: Schismatoglottis javanica, commonly known as the Java schismatoglottis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many diverse orchid species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in loose clusters. It is often grown as an ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions due to its unique foliage.
